dt: {bc}one of the subdivisions of a play: such as
{bc}a division of an act presenting continuous action in one place
{bc}a single situation or unit of dialogue in a play
{bc}a motion-picture or television episode or sequence
{bc}a real or imaginary prospect suggesting a stage setting
{bc}the place of an occurrence or action {bc}{sx|locale||}
{bc}an exhibition of anger or indecorous behavior

dt.t: He has stolen her salad, but she's too well-mannered to {phrase}make a scene{/phrase} {gloss}=act in a disruptive way{/gloss}.

dt: {bc}in a position to see the hidden workings

dt.t: taken {it}behind the scenes{/it} and told just how in fact the actual government … has operated

et: Middle French, stage, from Latin {it}scena, scaena{/it} stage, scene, probably from Etruscan, from Greek {it}skēnē{/it} shelter, tent, building forming the background for a dramatic performance, stage; perhaps akin to Greek {it}skia{/it} shadow {ma}{mat|shine|}{/ma}
shortdef: one of the subdivisions of a play: such as
a division of an act presenting continuous action in one place
a single situation or unit of dialogue in a play

dt: {bc}being or working out of public view or in secret

shortdef: being or working out of public view or in secret
revealing or reporting the hidden workings

dt: {bc}the arrangement of actors and scenery on a stage for a theatrical production
{bc}the physical setting of an action (as of a narrative or a motion picture) {bc}{sx|context||}

dt.t: this ordinary house that became the {wi}mise-en-scène{/wi} of an extraordinary drama

pt: {sc}background{/sc} {sc}setting{/sc} {sc}environment{/sc} {sc}milieu{/sc} {sc}mise-en-scène{/sc} mean the place, time, and circumstances in which something occurs. {sc}background{/sc} often refers to the circumstances or events that precede a phenomenon or development.

pt.t: the shocking decision was part of the {it}background{/it} of the riots

pt: {sc}setting{/sc} suggests looking at real-life situations in literary or dramatic terms.

pt.t: a militant reformer who was born into an unlikely social {it}setting{/it}

pt: {sc}environment{/sc} applies to all the external factors that have a formative influence on one's physical, mental, or moral development.

pt.t: the kind of {it}environment{/it} that produces juvenile delinquents

pt: {sc}milieu{/sc} applies especially to the physical and social surroundings of a person or group of persons.

pt.t: an intellectual {it}milieu{/it} conducive to artistic experimentation

pt: {sc}mise-en-scène{/sc} strongly suggests the use of properties to achieve a particular atmosphere or theatrical effect.

pt.t: a gothic thriller with a carefully crafted {it}mise-en-scène{/it}

shortdef: the arrangement of actors and scenery on a stage for a theatrical production
the physical setting of an action (as of a narrative or a motion picture) : context
